contextId.information: These two words mean approximately the same thing and emphasize that these are "lies intended to deceive." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of his anger. AT: "incredibly angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of his prudence. AT: "caution and careful judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These words mean basically the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These words share similar meanings and refer to the amazing things that God had done. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean basically the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words are similar and can be combined. AT: "shake with fear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "dream" and "visions" both refer to the same dream that is described in this chapter. AT: "visions while he was dreaming" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
This repetition of ideas emphasizes that this kingdom will never come to an end. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two terms mean basically the same thing and emphasize that this will concern all forms of official authority. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "commands" and "decrees" share similar meanings and refer to the whole law. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "anger" and "wrath" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how terrible God's anger is when he acts on it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

To "open the eyes" is an idiom that means to see. These two phrases means the same thing and emphasize Daniel's desire for God to pay attention to his prayer. AT: "notice us" or "pay attention" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "insight" and "understanding" mean the same thing and emphasize that Gabriel will help Daniel to understand the message completely. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These words are used together to make the importance clear. AT: "You must clearly understand" or "You must know for sure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

These words basically mean the same thing. The repetition is to show that the ruler will prevent all types of sacrifices. AT: "all forms of sacrificing" or "every type of offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The phrases "lift himself up" and "make himself great" mean the same thing and indicate that the king will become very proud. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: lift himself up and make himself great
